text.p: These are the leading stories in the Skopje press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Skopje and Belgrade sign agreements which will facilitate commerce and "transform smugglers into businessmen".
- Electricity prices to go up by 50 percent from October 1 and the national supplier Elektrostopanstvo announces more price hikes by the end of the year.

- Preparations start in Ohrid for the first multinational military exercise within the Partnership for peace programme, "Savior 96", which will group Albania, Bulgaria, Romania, Slovenia, Turkey, Italy, Macedonia and the U.S.
